includedAssets.title: Cinderella (1950)
includedAssets.synopsis: Disney's take on the timeless fairy tale is told through the eyes of Gus and Jaq, two mice who watch Cinderella blossom from downtrodden domestic slave to glass-slippered princess. But while Cinders has three fairy godmothers to help her escape the tyranny of her wicked stepmother and ugly sisters, Gus and Jacques must deal with aptly named housecat Lucifer on their own. Flowing animation, fun characters and a sprinkling of jaunty songs to give it that extra Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo!
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: While the entire kingdom attends a wondrous party, Cinderella is locked up at home. Will she make it to the royal ball? Much-loved animation.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: Disney's take on the timeless fairy tale is told through the eyes of Gus and Jaq, two mice who watch Cinderella blossom from downtrodden domestic slave to glass-slippered princess. But while Cinders has three fairy godmothers to help her escape the tyranny of her wicked stepmother and ugly sisters, Gus and Jacques must deal with aptly named housecat Lucifer on their own. Flowing animation, fun characters and a sprinkling of jaunty songs to give it that extra Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo!

includedAssets.title: Cinderella (2015)
includedAssets.synopsis: The enduring tale of the oppressed scullery maid who defies her evil step-mother to snare a prince gets a sumptuous live-action run out from director Kenneth Branagh. Downton Abbey's Lily James winsomely plays Cinders but it's Cate Blanchett as the villainous Lady Tremaine who's the dark star of the show. When her beloved father dies, Cinders finds herself at the whim of her evil stepmother and her vilely self-obsessed daughters but resolutely sticks to her real mum's advice: 'Have courage and be kind..."
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Kenneth Branagh's lavish, live-action retelling of the classic fairytale stars Lily James, Cate Blanchett and Richard Madden.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: The enduring tale of the oppressed scullery maid who defies her evil step-mother to snare a prince gets a sumptuous live-action run out from director Kenneth Branagh. includedAssets.title: Cinderella
includedAssets.synopsis: When her father unexpectedly dies, a young woman is left to tirelessly serve her wicked step-mother and cruel step-sisters, hoping someday something magical will save her. Classic 1950s Disney animation and Kenneth Branagh’s 2015 live action reboot starring Lily James, Richard Madden, Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham Carter and Derek Jacobi.
